posts.post_content:
First strike here, Flavorwise, is that you are ambushed by the spider.
  
   
 Look at the art. The Spider just dropped down on this guy and is all like "Hi, lol." and the guy is, well, probably in need of new pants.

posts.post_content:
@Tiggurix  
It's a subterranean spider, sort of like [Giant Trap Door Spider](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Trap Door Spider) (which also lacks reach). Flavor-wise, spiders' reach comes from the ability to weave a [Web](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Web), which isn't often done underground.

posts.post_content:
The Size of Spiders, and the Reactions of Kryptnyt.  
by Kryptnyt  
  
1mm Aww lookit the lil guy  
1cm \*squish\*  
1inch Ugh! \*smash\*  
1.5 inch EEEEE! \*finds something that can be used like a club\* \*splat\*  
3 inch Somebody left their pet spider here. Is it yours? \*strokes\*  
5 inch Blimey look at the size of that bugger!  
1 foot Wow! Its a spider, but its like an animal! Cool!  
3 feet Neat... I'm gonna stay away from that  
6 feet Yikes! Its as big as me! What is this, a horror film?  
12 feet CALL THE POWER RANGERS OMG SAVE ME
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Underpowered and almost completely uninteresting; a pretty typical Homelands card. The only reason to even glance at it is the somewhat odd granting of First Strike to a green card, but even that is a mere curiosity, not a significant, exploitable feature, even if it worked outside of blocking scenarios.

@garbagegatherer: Exactly, that was the first thing I wondered when I finished reading this card. I had never expected there to be a Spider without reach without good reason.

@longwinded: Thank you! =)

@kryptnyt: First of all, spiders are just as much a good and true animal as you and me, and secondly, I can't say I approve of your hostility towards innocent arachnids.
